page.title: 10CHAPELS
page.content: RELIGION - The largest Chapel building, formerly the Congregational Church,now the Village Hall. The smallest the Primitive Methodist, built in stone 150 yrs ago, seats 50 but the membership has declined. Three regular attenders each Sunday. The Wesleyan Reform chapel, belonging to the Bakewell Circuit, was built in 1852 of brick which is now rendered with pebble-dash. The chapel seats about 70 but has 6 members attending services each Sunday. There are no other religious buildings in the village so Catholics go either to Wirksworth or Ashbpourne for worship. Other denominations attend meeting places outside the village, or as inthe case of a group of Christians termed Brethern, meet in one another houses for worship, meditation and prayers.
